title: Israel's Far-Right Kingmakers Draw on U.S. Funding — Despite Terror Classifications
description:
Even as some in D.C. have expressed concern about the figures in Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition, little is done about the tax-exempt U.S. supporters of Israel’s far right.

The post Israel’s Far-Right Kingmakers Draw on U.S. Funding — Despite Terror Classifications appeared first on The Intercept.

title: Nobel Laureates Press Egypt to Free Alaa Abd El Fattah, Writer on Hunger Strike, Before COP27
description:
Nobel winners have urged world leaders to use their remarks at the COP27 climate conference in Egypt to press for the release of political prisoners, including Alaa Abd El Fattah.

The post Nobel Laureates Press Egypt to Free Alaa Abd El Fattah, Writer on Hunger Strike, Before COP27 appeared first on The Intercept.

title: The Fed's War on Workers
description:
How the Federal Reserve is undermining workers’ recent modest gains.

The post The Fed’s War on Workers appeared first on The Intercept.
